intro: Gonolobus glaberrimus, commonly known as the smooth gonolobus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth surface. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain seeds with tufts of silky hair, aiding in wind dispersal.
